Key Match Events: Uceta entered in the bottom of the eighth inning with one out and two men on base in a 4-4 game. Cal Stevenson doubled to give the Phillies a 6-4 lead.
Uceta allowed an RBI single to Buddy Kennedy.
Uceta allowed a two-run home run to Trea Turner.
Bryce Harper doubled in the next at-bat.
Uceta hit Nick Castellanos with a fastball right around his waistline.
The benches cleared as both teams had some choice words for one another after the hit-by-pitch.
The umpires decided to eject Uceta from the game.
The Phillies wound up winning the game 9-4.
Uceta received a three-game suspension from Major League Baseball for intentionally hitting Castellanos.
Manager Kevin Cash also received a one-game suspension for his player’s actions.
The Phillies won the next game Wednesday night to sweep the Rays out of Philadelphia.
Castellanos hit a two-run home run in the first inning after being hit by the pitch the night before.
Post-Match Reflections: Moments like what happened Tuesday night can bring a team closer together and generate momentum in the ensuing games.
The Phillies hold an 8.0-game lead over the New York Mets in the NL East and own the best record in baseball.
The Castellanos hit-by-pitch and the support from his teammates could be a spark as the Phillies head into the final push of the regular season and the postseason.
The Phillies have 16 games left before the postseason begins.
The Phillies believe they have the right talent and clubhouse to do something special in 2024.
